column2: MINNESOTA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Minnesota

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: stop if necessary.
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: obey signals from crossing guards.

column2: 2. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column10: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 3. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Do not enter.
column8: Stop.

column2: 4. This is:
column4: a side road sign.
column8: a reduction of lanes sign.

column2: 5. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column8: regardless of your direction.

column2: 6. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column6: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column8: stare straight ahead at all times.
column10: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.

column2: 7. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the right side of the road.
column6: straight down the middle of the road.
column8: towards the left side of the road.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 8. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Lap and shoulder belt only
column8: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 9. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column8: Warning signs

column2: 10. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may not turn right
column6: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column8: You must increase your speed
column10: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 11. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Merging traffic ahead
column8: Proceed with caution

column2: 12. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 13. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
column8: Never.

column2: 14. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column10: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.

column2: 15. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: flash your lights.
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column8: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column8: Merge
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 18. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: The bus is about to stop.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 19. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: try your emergency lights.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 20. Alcohol causes:
column4: loss of concentration.
column8: poor judgment.

column2: 21. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 22. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

column2: 23. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 24. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 25. This traffic sign warns you about:
column4: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.
column8: merging traffic.

column2: 26. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your rearview mirror.
column6: you cannot see without moving your head.
column8: you see in your side mirror.

column2: 27. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: solid yellow
column8: solid white

column2: 28. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.
column8: Whoever enters the intersection first.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Turn right or go through
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 30. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: be ready to react to road hazards.
column8: keep your eyes moving.

column2: 31. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 32. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Diamond
column8: Triangle

column2: 33. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: steer right
column6: stay in the center of your lane
column8: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 34. A motorist arriving at the intersection must yield the right of way to motorists who arrived before him.
column4: False

column2: 35. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: a divided highway is ahead.
column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 36. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column10: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 37. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.
column8: the direction they should travel.

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column8: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column10: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 39. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: use only one hand on the wheel.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp curves ahead
column8: Intersection ahead
